channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: U.S. police trainers with far-right ties are teaching hundreds of cops. https://t.co/evfmoaVyTc
@Peter_Wehner https://t.co/zsfKu1C62G
California reservoirs: The state's two largest are already at 'critically low levels' and the dry season is just starting. https://t.co/CVCxDVETfr
Finally, A Personality Quiz Backed By Science. https://t.co/U9J2Hhy15W
How the South Won the Civil War review: the path from Jim Crow to Donald Trump. https://t.co/4LIWwyYN9k
@tad yes of course. and unconstitutional as well.

1/6 I read that former VP Pence was upset that current VP Harris said she was in favor of abortion rights. He must be feeling pretty good, cause he's a religious zealot and the religious zealots are getting their way, forcing the rest of us to obey the rules of his religion, even
2/6 though the Constitution says clearly he doesn't have that right. It's in the first amendment if you're looking for it..
3/6 Then I wondered, since he cares so much about the unborn, how much would he be willing to suffer for each child born to a mother who doesn't want the child. There's a lot of pain involved in being an incubator for Mike Pence's religion. Would he be willing to suffer the pain?
4/6 It costs a lot of money too. Would he be willing to pay for the care of all the unborn he insists should be carried to term?
5/6 In other words, it's easy for him to have a strong opinion about this, he doesn't have to suffer, or risk his life, or pay money he doesn't have.
6/6 If he's such a moral person perhaps he'll put some skin into this crusade of his.
Are the Repubs on the Supreme Court political hacks or thoughtful jurists?
